comments.content: Any clues on what this androgynous style serif might be?
Can't identify it. It feels "bespoke" to me. What's the sample origin?

Its derived from Times, but I agree with Ryuk, probably a custom job. Suggest you check out [Stanley](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829042945/http:/typophile.com/wiki/lhttp%3A/%252Fwww.optimo.ch/typefaces_Stanley_Regular.html) as it has a similar temperament...

For some reason link didn't post...  
 [http://www.optimo.ch/typefaces\_Stanley\_Regular.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829042945/http:/www.optimo.ch/typefaces_Stanley_Regular.html "http://www.optimo.ch/typefaces\_Stanley\_Regular.html")

Thanks everyone for your help!  
The sample was sent by a friend, but after doing some digging, I was able find out where it came from. Seems it was a custom type.

Zak Group  
 [http://www.zakgroup.co.uk/projects/view/fridericianum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829042945/http:/www.zakgroup.co.uk/projects/view/fridericianum "http://www.zakgroup.co.uk/projects/view/fridericianum")

Thanks for the feedback. You're right, custom. Font is simply called 'Frederick'. Here's the complete alphabet coming from [their website](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829042945/http:/www.fridericianum.org/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140829042945im_/http:/typophile.com/files/02_5934.png)
